job_description: AWS DevOps Engineer- Location Open - job post Deloitte 11,492 reviews 821 Second Avenue Suite 200, Seattle, WA 98104 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time AWS DevOps Specialist Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology? A cloud solutions builder who wants to work in a collaborative environment. As an experienced AWS DevOps Specialist, you will have the ability to share new ideas and collaborate on projects as a consultant without the extensive demands of travel. Consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center - we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center. Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below ... Work you'll do/Responsibilities Help consult with clients on the system design of AWS environments Support cloud implementations, upgrades, migrations, and change requests on client cloud environments Create, implement, and assist in the development of scripts to automate everyday operations Maintain multiple (DevOps) environments based on client requirements Contribute to the configuration and setup of backups as well as setup automated AWS patching for Windows and Linux platforms Assist development teams to build and deploy micro services-based applications in public cloud with Continuous Integration & Continuous Deployment tools and processes Support program optimization to work within constructs of an AWS environment Assist in system migrations and system upgrades to create and deploy new cloud environments The Team Deloitte's Government & Public Services practice-our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Our team of over 15,000+ professionals bring fresh perspective to help you anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill your mission promise. The US Cloud Engineering Offering focuses on enabling our client's end-to-end journey from On-Premise to Cloud, with opportunities in the areas of Cloud Strategy and Op Model Transformation, Cloud Development & Integration, Cloud Migration, and Cloud Infrastructure & Managed Services. Cloud Engineering supports our clients as they improve agility, resilience and identifies opportunities to reduce IT operations spend through automation by enabling Cloud. We accelerate our clients toward a technology-driven future, leveraging vendor solutions, Deloitte-developed software products, tools, and accelerators. Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Management Information Systems or equivalent work experience 3+ years of experience with implementation, migrations, and upgrades in the AWS Cloud environment Experience with designing and deploying AWS Services like Elastic Compute (EC2), Storages (S3, EBS, EFS, Glacier and AWS Storage Gateway) and RDS Experience building and deploying micro-based applications in cloud with Continuous Integration & Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) tools and processes Proficient understanding of container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes 3+ years scripting experience to solve and automate common system tasks Automation scripting experience with Ansible, Terraform, Perl, Bash, Shell, and Python Must live a commutable distance to one of the following cities: Atlanta, GA; Austin, TX; Boston, MA; Charlotte, NC; Chicago, IL; Cincinnati, OH; Cleveland, OH; Dallas, TX; Denver, CO; Detroit, MI; Houston, TX; Indianapolis, IN; Kansas City, MO; Miami, FL; Minneapolis, MN; Nashville, TN; Philadelphia, PA; Phoenix, AZ; Pittsburgh, PA; Sacramento, CA; St. Louis, MO; San Diego, CA; Seattle, WA; Tallahassee, FL; Tampa, FL Ability to Travel 10%, on average, based on the work you do and the clients and industries/sectors you serve Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future. Preferred Qualifications AWS Certification Terraform Certification The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Deloitte, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is $77,000 to $128,000. You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. #LI-MG3

Staff Backend Engineer, Infrastructure - job post Recruiting From Scratch Seattle, WA 98105 $165,000 - $225,000 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $165,000 - $225,000 a year Job Type Full-time Who is Recruiting from Scratch: Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more. About our Client Our client is a serverless infrastructure company that has built a global state management platform for web developers. Their mission is to fundamentally change how software is built on the Internet and who gets to build it. They're looking for people who are passionate about improving the development experience for frontend engineers and who have strong opinions on what kinds of tools and workflows will remove barriers to getting things done. The early team at our client includes Principal Engineers and Engineering Directors who have led exabyte-scale storage projects, built custom global databases with trillions of records, and shipped desktop and mobile software onto billions of devices. They're a startup however and they're all excited about getting stuff done wherever is required in the stack. They've started to create something they believe is an entirely new and substantially better platform for teams of the future. They're eager to create the solution they wished they'd had for all those tricky frontend and backend problems they've wrestled to the ground over the years. They're motivated by the prospect of a new wave of teams using their product and excited to empower them to solve challenges that only recently were quite daunting. What excites them: They're looking for both junior and senior engineers who have a passion for building great things in a great environment. If you're highly-motivated, able to work independently, but also like to collaborate and work within a team, you're probably a good fit. Yes, they're building a state-of-the-art distributed database, so they have some very deep and very interesting systems challenges for infrastructure folks, but hopefully, folks who are also happy to also build a dashboard or work on developer SDKs. They're not just hiring infrastructure engineers however; most of their work is best applicable to general full-stack engineers with good taste and a product mindset. The Role: The team has a lot of experience running large systems at scale but we have a growing infrastructure footprint across databases, servers, and devops. We are looking for a backend engineer to help build and maintain infrastructure for the future of our client at scale. If you are passionate about building distributed systems and experienced with both designing and operating container infrastructure at scale, we would love to talk to you! What You’ll Do: Design, build, and maintain their global cloud infrastructure on AWS General ownership of SRE/DevOps which includes automating their monitoring and logging tools, developing traffic infrastructure for efficient and secure routing requests, managing release processing, versioning and CI/CD Establish reliability guidelines and ensuring systems meet our goals around durability, availability and performance Requirements: BS in Computer Science or related technical field or equivalent technical experience 5+ years of backend engineering experience working on infrastructure, production engineering, SRE, or systems engineering Good understanding of best practices for system configuration, building internal systems from scratch, and deploying services Experience scaling in a high growth startup environment Ability to write high quality code (knowledge of Rust is a plus) Location: They view in-person time as essential to make quick strategic decisions, to build empathy and to form early team culture. But they also value that working from home allows productive heads-down execution, extra time with family, commute breaks, and schedule flexibility. So, they're currently following a three/two hybrid schedule: three days in the office and (optionally) two days at home. Therefore, interested candidates need to be either in the Bay Area or willing to relocate so they're able to attend their office in San Francisco, CA. Fully remote is not an option at this time. Benefits: They have competitive salaries, generous early-employee equity packages, excellent benefits, and lots of plants in the office! Most of all however, they're a group of friendly, highly-motivated people who love working together and hope that you'll love working with them too. Base Salary Range: $165,000 to $225,000+ If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

DevOps Leader - job post Siemens 10,480 reviews Bellevue, WA $95,800 - $172,400 a year -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $95,800 - $172,400 a year Job Type Full-time Job Description: Looking for an experienced DevOps Leader for a direct hire opportunity to join an existing software development team. This person will assume a leadership position and will be responsible for enabling the software development team to operate efficiently to continually release value-oriented software functionality to existing production systems. This role reports directly to the development manager and will be expected to work closely with DevOps leaders from other development teams, with experts on our cloud infrastructure team as well as serve as a mentor for junior developers on the team. The DevOps Leader will have ownership of our team’s entire DevOps lifecycle and will be responsible for the implementation of the DevOps process. The DevOps Leader’s goal will be to maximize the automation of manual tasks for developing and deploying code and data to implement continuous deployment and continuous integration frameworks. They will also be responsible for maintaining high availability of production and non-production environments. Responsibilities The DevOps Leader is responsible for creating software deployment strategies that are essential for the successful deployment of software in the work environment. They improve the performance of the team. One of the primary roles of DevOps Leader is to assist the junior members of the team to make them aware of technologies like MySQL, AngularJS, Java, MyBatis, Groovy, and so-on. The DevOps Leader will work closely with the team’s lead developer to establish reusable tools and patterns to maximize code reusability while minimizing build-up of technical debt. The DevOps Leader is accountable for designing, building, and optimizing automation systems that help to execute business web and data infrastructure platforms. The DevOps Leader also develops self-service solutions for the team to deliver software with excellent quality and speed. They are also involved in designing and developing scaling strategies, automation scripts, and solutions to implement, streamline and executing the software. The DevOps Leader is involved in creating technology infrastructure, automation tools, and maintaining source code configuration management. They are accountable for conducting training sessions to the juniors in the team, and other groups regarding how to build processes wherein the dependencies are showcased in the code. The DevOps Leader also deals with tasks like management and development of continuous integration and deployment solutions across various sites. Required Knowledge/Skills, Education, and Experience Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science or equivalent 5+ years in software development and work experience as a DevOps Engineer Candidates must possess ample knowledge and experience in system automation, deployment, and implementation Candidates must possess experience in using Windows Server, GitLab, Maven, Ant, Jenkins, and ample experience in configuring and automating the monitoring tools. The candidates should also possess experience in the software development process, tools and languages like: HTML5, JavaScript, CSS AngularJS, Bootstrap Charting libraries (Chart.js, Highcharts, etc…) Business process diagramming (BPMN.io / bpmn-js) Java development / Tomcat Database persistence frameworks (i.e. MyBatis) SQL for relational databases (MySQL or equivalent) Git / GitLab for source code management Eclipse, Visual Studio Code Jersey, JSON, REST Should possess excellent communication skills, which is essential to execute their duty to the juniors in the team. Having excellent communication skills will ensure that information is conveyed clearly, which in turn determines the team’s performance. Must be a result-oriented individual, self-motivated and proactive beyond their duty. They should be capable of multi-tasking, meeting deadlines, should remain calm during uncertainties and work in a collaborative environment, creative, highly analytical, and strategic thinker. Should possess knowledge on fundamental Windows Server, monitoring, editing, and command-based tools is essential. It’s also essential to have sound knowledge of cloud infrastructure with AWS and its array of integrated services. Should be a people’s person who is capable of developing a good rapport with other people in the organization. They should inspire trust and confidence in other members of the team. It should be ensured that there is no unnecessary intervention in between. At Siemens we are always challenging ourselves to build a better future. We need the most innovative and diverse Digital Minds to develop tomorrow’s reality. Find out more about the Digital world of Siemens here: www.siemens.com/careers/digitalminds The salary range for this position is $95,800 to $172,400 and this role is eligible to earn incentive compensation. Siemens offers a variety of health and wellness benefits to employees. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: www.benefitsquickstart.com. In addition, this position is eligible for time off in accordance with Company policies, including paid sick leave, paid parental leave, PTO (for non-exempt employees) or non-accrued flexible vacation (for exempt employees). #DISW #LI-PLM #LI-VS1 Organization: Digital Industries Company: Siemens Industry Software Inc. DevOps Engineer - job post Landmark Global 60 reviews Washington State • Remote $110,000 - $125,000 a year -  Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Salary $110,000 - $125,000 a year Job Type Full-time Company Background Landmark Global are the experts in international delivery by combining postal networks and alternative delivery providers. We are part of the North American division of bpost, Belgium’s national postal service, with expertise in parcels & logistics. Bpost employs more than 20,000 people, handles billions of shipments per year and delivers to more than five million addresses every day. For more than a decade, Landmark Global, with its roots in SoCal, has enabled our customers to expand globally. Our business has grown from basic international mail and parcel delivery to full service, end-to-end solutions. This includes parcel delivery, fulfillment, proprietary technology and trade consulting, which provide our clients the capability to sell to millions of customers worldwide. We are strategically located close to our customers worldwide, covering most time zones. Our technology is web-based, scalable and agile. Mercury, our proprietary web-based software, was developed on the foundations of our logistics expertise and client requests. We provide a flexible application that works with any existing technologies. Position Summary We’re growing quickly across 4 continents and have many exciting technologies to support! We are looking for someone with strong knowledge and experience of supporting cloud & internal server infrastructure to support our flagship, homegrown web application in addition to other corporate systems. This position will help transform our infrastructure to the next level of automation, security and stability. Job Description Core responsibilities will include the following areas: ● Maintain and monitor the cloud infrastructure in AWS ● Deploy/Update cloud instances using Chef ● Define network and security structure using CloudFormation ● Check for security issues in AWS using tools such as Trendmicro Cloud Conformity and Rapid 7 IDR ● Maintain and monitor the network infrastructure between AWS and our 10+ North America locations ● Create/maintain scripts to automate processes ● Research new technology for improvements ● Work closely with the Development and IT Operations teams to provide needed tools and resources ● Additional duties as assigned Position Requirements ● 2-4 years relevant work experience ● Bachelor’s degree preferred, but not required ● Familiarity with Chef, AWS CloudFormation, Git ● Experience with implementation of CI/CD ● Strong understanding of cloud security ● Strong knowledge of Linux operating system Position can be hybrid / remote. Candidate must be willing to travel when required for meetings or projects. Competitive package includes salary plus bonus plan and remote work from home allowance. Passion for our mission and vision is required! Responsibilities: Collaborating with developers, system administrators and other IT staff to design and implement solutions Managing and mentoring the team of DevOps engineers Defining and maintaining IT service level agreements (SLAs) Identifying and implementing process improvements Managing projects and budgets Staying up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies Ensuring compliance with security and regulatory standards Representing the team in meetings and presentations with other departments and external stakeholders Qualifications: A bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field 4+ years of experience in a DevOps, software development, or systems administration role Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix administration and scripting languages such as Python or Bash Experience with cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and container orchestration (e.g. Kubernetes) Experience with continuous integration and deployment tools (e.g. Jenkins, TravisCI, CircleCI) Experience with infrastructure as code (e.g. Terraform, Ansible) Knowledge of configuration management tools (e.g. Puppet, Chef, Ansible) Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g. Prometheus, Grafana, Elasticsearch) Strong problem-solving and analytical skills Strong communication and leadership skills Experience working in an Agile development environment Familiarity with security best practices Familiarity with ITIL framework.
